title.rendered: Islamabad vs Karachi, Pakistan T20 League: Today’s Match Preview, Fantasy Cricket Team

content.rendered:
We have opted for a fantasy cricket team based on the recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Probable XIs

Islamabad: Colin Munro, Rahmanullah Gurbaz, Rassie van der Dussen, Shadab Khan (c), Azam Khan (wk), Asif Ali, Faheem Ashraf, Tom Curran, Hasan Ali, Zeeshan Zameer, Abrar Ahmed

Karachi: Matthew Wade, Adam Rossington (wk), Tayyab Tahir, Shoaib Malik, Irfan Khan, Imad Wasim (c), Ben Cutting, Aamer Yamin, Mohammad Amir, Tabraiz Shamsi, Akif Javed

Venue: Pindi Club Ground, Rawalpindi

Pitch Report

Only one T20 game has been played at the venue.

Type: Good for batting

Fantasy Tips of The Day

Only once in his last 10 T20s has Mohammad Amir gone wicketless. When he last bowled at the Pindi Club Ground, he bagged a four-for.

Imad Wasim and Matthew Wade are the only players from Karachi to feature in the Best11 for the last five games. Incidentally, both registered a fifty on their previous visit to the venue.

Hasan Ali has already picked seven wickets, including two three-wicket hauls this season. Against Karachi, he has picked 17 wickets in 14 outings.

Although Shoaib Malik has blown hot and cold in this edition, he has encouraging numbers against Islamabad: 417 runs at 35 including the highest score of 68.

With consecutive two-fors, Shadab Khan has announced his arrival into the league. Against Karachi, he has taken 13 wickets and has the highest score of 54*.

By picking three wickets in the last match, Tom Curran forced himself into the Best11. When he last bowled against Karachi, he finished with figures of 2 for 42.

When these teams locked horns earlier in the tournament, Colin Munro (58 off 28) and Azam Khan (44 runs and two catches) were the captain and vice-captain of the Best11 respectively.

Before being dismissed for six in the last game, Tayyab Tahir slammed four half-centuries in a row at home this season.
